aboutMe.text:
Full-stack engineer graduated from a French engineering school and who had completed a semester at KAIST. I am well-versed in a wide range of frontend technologies (major SPA frameworks) and backend technologies (Node.js/Nest.js/Hapi.js, Java/Spring). I also had the opportunity to work on other technologies during my internships in major French multinationals or my studies (Android, Kotlin).
Passionate about technology, I was also able to learn in autonomy the principles of application design, lean management or clean architecture

kaist.title: Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology
kaist.subtitle: Exchange Semester

courses.course1: CS489 : Computer ethics and social issues
courses.course2: CS442 : Mobile computing, applications and networking

courses.course1: LOO2 : Object-Oriented System Analysis and Design
courses.course2: NF02 : Modeling and evaluation of complex IT systems
courses.course5: IF26: Secure design of mobile applications

sparkmate.title: Full-time job
sparkmate.subtitle: Software Engineer
sparkmate.description:
From ideas and conception to prototyping and pre production, we support the customer and develop technological solutions 

•Project analysis: understanding of project vision, writting of class diagrams, use cases, state diagrams, etc.
•Project management: acceptance testing, planning, monitoring, etc.
•Application design modeling (UI wise and architecture wise) 
•Development of applications (frontend and backend)
•CI/CD using GitLab, docker and AWS/GCP

ds.title: 6 months internship
ds.subtitle: FullStack Engineer
ds.description:
Development of widget prototypes (new features, evolutions, fixes)
• Process improvements: source code management, automated tests, build, continuous rollout.
• Use of the latest technologies and frameworks, front-end (React, Vue, d3), back-end (AWS, NestJs)
• Development, testing and release workflow (integration / continuous delivery / deployment) : Git, GitLab, webpack, TDD, Linting...

af.title: 6 months internship
af.subtitle: FullStack Engineer
af.description:
Improvement of existing Angular/Electron based applications
• Redesigning the GUIs of some applications to match the needs of the pilots
• Improving backend performance by code and complexity analysis and rework on Websocket
• Implementation of a Service Worker on an app to make it a Progressive Web App
